materials.raw_text: B: 40 g, Cd: 30 g, In: 10 g, Ni: 260 g, Tm: 20 g, Zn: 5 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - chemical supply stores; Cd (Cadmium metal) - metal suppliers; In (Indium metal) - electronics suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) - metal suppliers; Tm (Thulium oxide) - chemical supply stores; Zn (Zinc powder) - metal suppliers.
steps: B (Boron powder) - chemical supply stores; Cd (Cadmium metal) - metal suppliers; In (Indium metal) - electronics suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) - metal suppliers; Tm (Thulium oxide) - chemical supply stores; Zn (Zinc powder) - metal suppliers.

1. Wear appropriate safety gear (gloves, goggles, mask). 2. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 3. In a clean, dry container, combine B, Cd, In, Ni, Tm, and Zn powders in the specified amounts. 4. Mix thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or mechanical mixer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Wear appropriate safety gear (gloves, goggles, mask). 2. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 3. In a clean, dry container, combine B, Cd, In, Ni, Tm, and Zn powders in the specified amounts. 4. Mix thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or mechanical mixer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 1000째C at a rate of 10째C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 1000째C at a rate of 10째C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling methods to prevent cracking of the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling methods to prevent cracking of the material.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinding wheel to smooth out any rough edges and achieve a uniform finish. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface integrity and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinding wheel to smooth out any rough edges and achieve a uniform finish. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface integrity and prevent oxidation.
